intro: Diodia riparia, commonly known as waterweed or riverweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often branching stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes, stream banks, and flooded meadows. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a slight hairy texture. Diodia riparia plays a role in stabilizing soil in aquatic habitats and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
